intro: Tarenaya afrospina, commonly known as the African spiny tree, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
